pageContext.claim: “We're up 690,000 votes in Pennsylvania. 690,000. These aren't even close. It's not like, oh, it's [Inaudible] With 64% of the vote in, it's, uh, gonna be almost impossible to catch, and we're coming into good Pennsylvania areas where they happen to like your president, and ...so, we'll probably expand that.”
pageContext.analysis: Actually, most of the votes to be counted were in Democratic strongholds. Unlike many other states, mail and absentee ballots could not be counted before Election Day in Pennsylvania because the GOP-controlled legislature refused to authorize it. Within a day, Trump’s margin had shrunk to 41,000 votes, with about 300,000 left to count. Biden ultimately won the state by more than 80,000 votes.
